client.communication

Class ServerPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.communication.ServerPoller

  • public class ServerPoller
extends java.lang.Object
    The ServerPoller periodically calls the server to check if there is an updated game model, and if so, it retrieves the model and informs other relevant classes to update their model. This is needed due to the fact that the server cannot send the information at any given point to the client, only the client can ping the server.
    Author:
    Jordan Chipman

      • start

        public void start(long interval)
        Creates a thread for polling at the specified interval and begins polling.
        Parameters:
        interval - The polling rate, in ms.
        Preconditions
        The poller is not running and the interval is positive
        Postconditions
        The poller will be running

      • start

        public void start()
        Creates a thread for polling using the default poll interval
        Preconditions
        The poller is not running
        Postconditions
        The poller will be running

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the polling.
        Make sure to call this when you are done polling, in order to prevent resource leaks (threads are, in fact, a limited resource.)
        Preconditions
        the poller is running
        Postconditions
        the poller will not be running

        Preconditions
